iti19:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti19:2.1: “One thing, mendicants, arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
iti19:2.4: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t argue, insult, block, or reject each other.
iti19:2.5: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.”
iti19:2.6: That is what the Buddha said.
iti19:3.2: as is support for those in harmony.
iti19:3.3: Taking a stand on the teaching,
iti19:3.4: favoring harmony, they ruin no sanctuary.
iti19:3.5: After creating harmony in the Saṅgha,
iti19:3.6: they rejoice in heaven for an eon.”
iti19:4.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
